messages: cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:53): Hixie: "Must be invoked whenever a beforeunload event is targeted at or bubbles through the element or object." - s/element or //
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:02): http://blog.whatwg.org/styling-ie-noscript#comment-35694 - spam?

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:12): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0, when I moderated that comment, I checked the site, and it didn't fit the profile of a typical spam website and seemed to be web development related, even though the comment isn't really on topic
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:14): so more a case of self-promotion
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:14): yeah, that's what I thought

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:15): I could mark it as spam if you think that's a better course of action, but I try to reserve that for real spam sites instead of resorting to anything that could be conceived as censorship
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:16): i don't really care either way, it just triggered my spamometer so i thought i'd mention it
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:20): At best it is designed to get people to visit the mostly useless website to click on Google Ads
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:23): "DTD based SGML parsers", where are these used?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:25): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9, OpenSP is the major one, but its use is limited mainly to validators or non-HTML uses
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:30): more than that, SP is the only open-source SGML parse, as far as I know
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:31): So there's little reason why a language that doesn't lend itself to DTD-based validation should support it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:31): well, we should be killing DTD-validation
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:31): at every chance possible
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:32): James Clark himself said as much
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:32): some years ago
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:33): "we need to put a knife in the back of SGML" (or something along those lines)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:33): he said
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:34): some might say that it's fairly absurd that in 2009 the W3C Validator is still doing DTD-based validation
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:34): I agree, but I don't think people who want to support DTDs will
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:34): So a more pragmatic argument might be in order :)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:36): some might say that, seeing as this is the year 2009 (not 1989), people who want to support DTDs should probably not be our highest concern
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:37): maybe the rule should be that if you mention the term "DTD" un-ironically, you get knee-capped

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:40): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: Judging by the university mailing lists I'm on, "spam" just means any message that you aren't personally interested in, so on the blog you should just delete any comments that don't seem to add anything useful to the post
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:40): the problem is that DTD based validation has been the only reasonably reliable HTML4 validation method for many years, people have grown accustomed to them
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:40): You'd have to invent a machine that lets you kneecap people over the internet first
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:41): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: Who said it has to be a machine? You could use something like Mechanical Turk to farm the work out
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:41): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9, the alternative is to simply send the offending person an email virus or perform a DOS attack on them
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:42): or should we setup virtualkneecap.com?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:43): I suppose a DOS attack is similar to kneecapping, in online terms

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:47): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: RELAX NG has been around since 2000 or so. .. problem was that nobody involved with HTML did much with it until 2006 or so, when fantasai (and then hsivonen) started work on whattf schema  for HTML5 & WF2

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:55): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, yes, but there's also the stigma attatched to the DTD as being the only official validation method endorsed by the spec, and alternative validators using different techniques and which didn't strictly adhere to the spec were seen as inferior
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:57): even if their results were more useful in practice, like claiming unimplemented SGML shorthand features were invalid
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:57): never even heard of any HTML validators other than validator.w3.org
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:58): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: if such sentiment exists, better to just ignore it it without comment
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:58): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: we have this thing called validator.nu
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:59): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, http://validator.w3.org/docs/help.html#others
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:59): v.nu represents a corruption of the ideals
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:59): there are other ones too, but I can't remember their names or URLs
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:00): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, HTML5 in general represents a corruption of many people's ideals
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (15:00): And of idealism in general :)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:00): HTML5 is an abomination
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:02): it's ironic that 4 or 5 years ago, I shared the ideals of many who are complaining about HTML5 today. Though I've since been corrupted myself :-)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:02): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: that is a sign that you beliefs are changed to easily
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:03): next year, you'll believe something different
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:03): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, no, changing my beliefs is never easy. I'm really quite stubborn
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:03): stubborn?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:04): I can't believe it
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:04): yes. Don't you think so?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:04): no, you are the most reasonable person in the world
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:04): you should get a special aware
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:05): the Tactful and most Thougtfully Considered Opinions Award
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:08): I wanted to win the Smeghead award
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:09): too bad
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:09): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I mean, before I was involved with HTML5 I'd never even heard of any HTML validators other than validator.w3.org
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:09): although I didn't think "smeg" referred to a kind of cheese http://lastweekinhtml5.blogspot.com/2009/01/bonnie-prince-cheesie.html
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:10): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: that's of course because there are none
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:10): or were none before hsivonen appeared
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:11): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: Mr Last Week clearly wants to have sex with you
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:11): with you in particular
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:11): so you can choose to accept that and make it happen, or you
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:11): can politely decline
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:12): read between the lines, genius
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (15:12): Or he can lie, merely using it as a tool to figure out the secret identity of you-know-who
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:13): I'm sure we'll figure out the identity of Mr Last Week one day. There's no rush though
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:13): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: your IQ is clearly greater than that of former US President George W. Bush
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:13): which puts you in a special class
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:14): run with it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:14): take advantage of it
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (15:14): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: What if he just stops posting and disappears? Then it'll be too late
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:14): woo hoo! I join the elite 90% of the world's population with an IQ greater than Bush.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:14): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: strike while the iron is H O T hot
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:16): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: you are clearly the sorta super exemplar of our group
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:16): tall, poised
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:16): represent us well to the world, please
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:17): take your responsibilities seriously
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:21): what responsibilities does this new role of mine include?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:22): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: mostly, you have to provide sexual services to any lonely ladies in need of special attention
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (15:22): (as far as I read the contract at least)
